use-ttw: I read and post in this community
use-mailing-list: I read and post in this community
use-reddit: I read/lurk, but do not post
use-discord: I do not engage with this community
use-github-discuss: I read/lurk, but do not post
main-use-cases: Note-taking;Journalling;Task and project management (including CRMs);As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content);Programming;Other
share-wikis: No, but I may export content into other formats and share individual tiddlers, the whole wiki, or an extract of the wiki
value-of-tw: Great backend for custom plugins to manage/store/record various things (i.e. beekeeping).
tw-ability-level: I am comfortable using WikiText widgets (e.g. <$transclude>, <$list>...);I am comfortable writing filter expressions;I have written custom JavaScript
save-method: Single-file wiki through web browser with Download Saver (default saving mechanism);Multi-file wiki served through Node.js
diy-backup-info: Part of nightly home server backup

project-strengths:
Open communication and asking users for input before making decisions that might impact the system.
Very helpful and friendly community of pro-users that help even for very niche questions.
Looking forward to MultiWiki becoming mature so I can combine my numerous Node instances.
project-weaknesses:
More documentation in regards to interacting with TW via JS. Creating custom JS macros involves a lot of trial and error until the correct method is found and which parameters to pass in.

Documentation for some filter operators is confusing (i.e. jsonextract vs jsonget).

Also overall support for JSON could be improved so plugins do not need to rely on field names which causes collisions. Proposition: a parsejson operator
ok-to-publish: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
